citation.article-title: Desulfotomaculum thermobenzoicum subsp. thermosyntrophicum subsp. nov., a thermophilic, syntrophic, propionate-oxidizing, spore-forming bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Desulfotomaculum thermobenzoicum Tasaki et al. 1991

Desulfotomaculum thermobenzoicum (thermo.ben.zo'i.cum. Gr. adj. thermos hot; N.L. gen. n. benzoicum pertaining to benzoate; Desulfotomaculum thermobenzoicum a sausage-shaped organism that reduces sulphur compounds and oxidizes benzoate under anaerobic conditions)
Rod-shaped Gram-positive cells 1.0-2 μm x 3-11 μm in size with pointed ends, single or in pairs.
Strictly anaerobic, moderately thermophilic and neutrophilic.
The substrates used coupled to sulphate reduction are lactate, pyruvate, propionate and H2/CO2.
Pyruvate and lactate are degraded without sulphate.
Grows at 40-70 °C and pH 6-8; optimum conditions are at 55-62 °C and pH 7.0-7.2.
The DNA G­+C content is 52.8-53.7 mol%.Isolated from thermophilic methanogenic reactors.
